shopping.name: Tomato
shopping.benifits: Tomatoes contain lycopene, an antioxidant that reduces the risk of cancer and heart diseases.

shopping.name: Potato
shopping.benifits: Potatoes should be included in the diet of those having mouth ulcers. As they are easy to digest, they are good for patients. Consumption of potatoes helps to maintain the blood glucose level and keeps the brain alert and active.

shopping.name: Pomegranate
shopping.benifits: Pomegranate juice lowers bad cholesterol and raises good cholesterol. Gives a boost of energy and freshness.

shopping.name: Spinach
shopping.benifits: Palak contains low fat and cholesterol, but a good amount of fiber. They lower the risk of cancer and the occurrence of asthma.

shopping.name: Orange
shopping.benifits: It is rich in Antioxidants which protects the skin from free radicals and also protects against some cancers by suppressing cancer cell proliferation.

shopping.name: Banana
shopping.benifits: One banana supplies 30 percent of the daily vitamin B6 requirement and is rich in vitamin C and potassium.

shopping.name: Carrot
shopping.benifits: Carrots provide the highest content of vitamin A of all the vegetables. They aid in maintaining oral health and also decrease the risk of stroke and other heart diseases.

shopping.name: Cauliflower
shopping.benifits: One serving of cauliflower contains 77 percent of daily recommended value of vitamin C. Cauliflowers are rich in B complex vitamins, potassium and manganese.

shopping.name: Mango
shopping.benifits: Mangos are known to contain more than 20 different vitamins and minerals, which make them a superfood. Laden with the goodness of Vitamin C and A, mangoes also have a high fibre content.

shopping.name: Chicken Breast
shopping.benifits: This is rich in vitamins like E, B1, B-2, and B-6. Vitamin E, for instance, is a rich anti-oxidant and prevents free radicals from cell damage. Being rich in minerals, meat helps to build and maintain strong bones.

shopping.name: Fish
shopping.benifits: Fish is filled with omega-3 fatty acids and vitamins such as D and B2 (riboflavin). Fish is rich in calcium and phosphorus and a great source of minerals, such as iron, zinc, iodine, magnesium, and potassium.
